ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much practical insights about pursuing a career as an artist, including how to write an artist bio, statement, and how to present your work, in addition to how to install and organize a gallery exhibition with a group of people.

Through this course, I learned how to navigate the art world and bring my perspective to a 3 dimensional space. Although there were some personal constraints in terms with what I could achieve during this term, I was able to be supported to a fruitful conclusion.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A lot of the work was individual and I felt a bit lost at times.

This is a very challenging course for someone outside of the art major. It is very self-guided in terms of the freedom this course provides to develop skills already developed through other art courses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Only take this class if you have time in your semester. Although the class is not hard, it can be time consuming.

Yes, I would recommend this course if you are serious about pursuing sculpture in the future, but it's not really a class for people who just want to take a sculpture class, if that make sense--it's pretty intense.
I would strongly recommend this course to any other student with an interest in sculpture or art generally.
I would recommend this course for someone who was thinking of focusing on sculpture for their final art thesis or were interested in pursuing installation art.
